00024 #ifndef _MSDATAANALYZER_HPP_
00025 #define _MSDATAANALYZER_HPP_
00026 
00027 
00028 #include "data/msdata/MSData.hpp"
00029 #include <iosfwd>
00030 
00031 
00032 namespace pwiz {
00033 namespace analysis {
00034 
00035 
00036 using namespace msdata;
00037 
00038 
00039 ///
00040 /// Interface for MSData analyzers.
00041 ///
00042 /// MSDataAnalyzer encapsulates a passive update strategy.  The MSDataAnalyzer expects to  
00043 /// handle events generated from an outside driver.  This allows the driver to 
00044 /// control access to the MSData object -- in particular, the driver can ensure
00045 /// that scans are read from file only once.
00046 ///
00047 /// Event sequence: 
00048 ///   - open
00049 ///   - loop: 
00050 ///     - updateReqested
00051 ///     - update
00052 ///   - close
00053 ///
00054 /// UpdateRequest_Ok handles the following use case: a spectrum cache wants to cache 
00055 /// only those spectra that are requested by other MSDataAnalyzers; it won't request 
00056 /// any updates, but it needs to see any update requested by someone else.
00057 ///
00058 class MSDataAnalyzer
00059 {
00060     public:
00061 
00062     /// information about the data to be analyzed
00063     struct DataInfo
00064     {
00065         const MSData& msd;
00066         std::string sourceFilename;
00067         std::string outputDirectory;
00068         std::ostream* log;
00069 
00070         DataInfo(const MSData& _msd) : msd(_msd), log(0) {}
00071     };
00072 
00073     enum UpdateRequest
00074     {
00075         UpdateRequest_None,      // do not update
00076         UpdateRequest_Ok,        // will accept an update
00077         UpdateRequest_NoBinary,  // update requested, no binary data needed 
00078         UpdateRequest_Full       // update requested, with binary data 
00079     };
00080 
00081     /// \name Event Handling 
00082     //@{
00083 
00084     /// start analysis of the data
00085     virtual void open(const DataInfo& dataInfo) {}
00086 
00087     /// ask analyzer if it wants an update
00088     virtual UpdateRequest updateRequested(const DataInfo& dataInfo,
00089                                           const SpectrumIdentity& spectrumIdentity) const 
00090     {   
00091         return UpdateRequest_None;
00092     }
00093 
00094     /// analyze a single spectrum
00095     virtual void update(const DataInfo& dataInfo, 
00096                         const Spectrum& spectrum) {}
00097 
00098     /// end analysis of the data
00099     virtual void close(const DataInfo& dataInfo) {} 
00100     //@}
00101 
00102     virtual ~MSDataAnalyzer() {}
00103 };
00104 
00105 
00106 typedef boost::shared_ptr<MSDataAnalyzer> MSDataAnalyzerPtr;
00107 
00108 
00109 /// This auxilliary class should be specialized for MSDataAnalyzers
00110 /// whose instantiation is controlled by user-supplied strings 
00111 /// (via command line, config file, etc.).
00112 template <typename analyzer_type>
00113 struct analyzer_strings
00114 {
00115     /// string identifier for the analyzer
00116     static const char* id() {return "analyzer_traits not specialized";}
00117 
00118     /// description of the analyzer
00119     static const char* description() {return typeid(analyzer_type).name();} 
00120 
00121     /// format of args string
00122     static const char* argsFormat() {return "";}
00123 
00124     /// description of args string options
00125     static std::vector<std::string> argsUsage() {return std::vector<std::string>();}
00126 };
00127 
00128 
00129 /// 
00130 /// container of MSDataAnalyzer (composite pattern)
00131 ///
00132 class MSDataAnalyzerContainer : public MSDataAnalyzer,
00133                                 public std::vector<MSDataAnalyzerPtr>
00134 {
00135     public:
00136 
00137     /// \name MSDataAnalyzer interface 
00138     //@{
00139     virtual void open(const DataInfo& dataInfo);
00140 
00141     virtual UpdateRequest updateRequested(const DataInfo& dataInfo,
00142                                           const SpectrumIdentity& spectrumIdentity) const;
00143 
00144     virtual void update(const DataInfo& dataInfo, 
00145                         const Spectrum& spectrum);
00146 
00147     virtual void close(const DataInfo& dataInfo);
00148     //@}
00149 };
00150 
00151 
00152 ///
00153 /// event generator for MSDataAnalyzer
00154 ///
00155 class MSDataAnalyzerDriver
00156 {
00157     public:
00158 
00159     /// instantiate with an MSDataAnalyzer
00160     MSDataAnalyzerDriver(MSDataAnalyzer& analyzer);
00161 
00162     enum Status {Status_Ok, Status_Cancel};
00163 
00164     /// progress callback interface
00165     class ProgressCallback
00166     {
00167         public:
00168         virtual size_t iterationsPerCallback() const {return 100;}
00169         virtual Status progress(size_t index, size_t size) {return Status_Ok;}
00170         virtual ~ProgressCallback(){}
00171     };
00172 
00173     ///
00174     /// analyze a single MSData object, calling back to client if requested
00175     /// 
00176     /// If progressCallback->progress() returns Status_Cancel, analysis
00177     /// is canceled and Status_Cancel is returned.
00178     ///
00179     Status analyze(const MSDataAnalyzer::DataInfo& dataInfo,
00180                    ProgressCallback* progressCallback = 0) const;
00181 
00182     private:
00183     MSDataAnalyzer& analyzer_;
00184 };
